function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Conversion of office spaces in city centers to residential units could lead to changes in population density and potential disease exposure.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shortages of affordable housing for low-income people and families","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decrease in road traffic flows and major cities experiencing drops in rush-hour traffic congestion","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased investment in energy efficiency and retrofitting of buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of infection in cities due to close contact in vulnerable households, construction sites, and local businesses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on digital platforms for cultural resources, municipal services, and participation may lead to increased virtual interactions and dependence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential long-term coexistence with covid-19 leading to ongoing public health concerns and the need for sustainable recovery strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerable groups such as the elderly, women, the poor, and migrants disproportionately affected by pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards digital life and remote work","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing trust in local authorities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 crisis-response measures may discourage expansion and maintenance of housing stock, leading to barriers restricting mobility and impacting financial and economic resilience.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Customized policy responses to covid-19 are important based on the local situation and the needs of local people.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cities may suffer different consequences of the health crisis, impacting their recovery options and possibilities based on their trade openness, labor market structure, and industrial composition.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary suspension of evictions in multiple countries","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mortgage and rent payment suspensions in multiple countries","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Support measures for construction industry and utility bill payment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to lack of social distancing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic costs to businesses and people due to social distancing measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in living preferences leading to depopulation of large cities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of green and sustainable construction in the housing industry","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safe housing during the pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interdisciplinary research on the impact of housing policies on covid-19 spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of public health and safety infrastructure","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor urban design and architecture contributing to disease propagation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of crises on sustainable development","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased mental health issues due to restricted outdoor recreation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disruption to energy demand and supply due to covid-19 gbcss","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Undermined indoor environmental quality ieq in buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New designs of living spaces may not effectively address contagious disease propagation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sustainability rating methods may not adequately prioritize social and health aspects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate response to pandemic resilience requirements by existing green building certification systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for comfortable and high-quality housing due to the covid-19 crisis","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlap of residential and office real estate sectors","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in sustainability requirements for residential buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Globalization and interconnectivity conventions could be challenged, leading to changes in politics and multi-scalar policies.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The pandemic could be an opportunity and impetus to move away from unsustainable practices towards more resources","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of regular physical exercise","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of vitamin d from
